intro: Cullumia aculeata var. aculeata, commonly known as the spiny cullumia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, urn-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are narrow, leathery, and covered in fine, hair-like structures, contributing to its rugged appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
